chapter.title: Subjects
chapter.para: The PMB subject index corresponds to a subject arrangement of the library collection. The subjects are arranged to form a herarchically structured thesaurus.
The subject index can be displayed or not on the OPAC home page depending on your library's requirements, and the subjects that you can browse in PMB correspond to choices made by your library.

section.title: Browsing the subject index

figure.title: The display of subjects on the OPAC home page

section.para: The subject index on the OPAC enables you to browse the virtual shelves of a library like you would be doing on Yahoo.

Depending on your library settings, the OPAC home page displays a subject browser. Under each of the main subject headings (here, Art and Culture, Social sciences, for example), are listed the first sub-headings.

A subject heading may contain one or more sub-headings, or none. Under this subject may fall one or more works of the library, or none. A subject heading may also contain references: "see" references directing the user to another subject, or "see also" references suggesting the reader to look also under another subject.

section.title: Quick search by subject
section.para: Enter one or more keywords, tick Subjects to confine the search to Subjects only, and then click on Search to validate.

section.title: Search by terms under subject
section.para: Search by terms is useful for browsing and surfing from one subject to another. The central interface is divided in two areas to allow for subject-to-subject browsing.
